Then answered the Lord unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?

Then Job answered the Lord, and said,
And Job spake, and said,

verses.text: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.

similars.text: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

verses.text: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?

similars.text: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.
With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words: but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.
A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.
With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

verses.text: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.
Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.

similars.text: Therefore, I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
And the day shall come when the nations of the earth shall tremble because of her, and shall fear because of her terrible ones. The Lord hath spoken it. Amen.
Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
And then shall the Lord set his foot upon this mount, and it shall cleave in twain, and the earth shall tremble, and reel to and fro, and the heavens also shall shake.
Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
Therefore, I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.

verses.text: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.

similars.text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

verses.text: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.

similars.text: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments--then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.
Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
Thus saith the Lord, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;
For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

verses.text: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.
Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.

similars.text: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:

verses.text: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.

similars.text: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
And it came to pass that he said unto me: Look! And I looked as if to look upon him, and I saw him not; for he had gone from before my presence.
The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

verses.text: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?

similars.text: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the Lord hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
And inasmuch as thy brethren shall rebel against thee, they shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord.
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

Therefore it shall come to pass that whosoever will not believe in my words, who am Jesus Christ, which the Father shall cause him to bring forth unto the Gentiles, and shall give unto him power that he shall bring them forth unto the Gentiles, (it shall be done even as Moses said) they shall be cut off from among my people who are of the covenant.
And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.
And if the Lord shall say--Because of thine iniquities thou shalt be cut off from my presence--he will cause that it shall be so.
The Lord hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.
For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the world to come.
And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.

And when ye shall see these sayings coming forth among you, then ye need not any longer spurn at the doings of the Lord, for the sword of his justice is in his right hand; and behold, at that day, if ye shall spurn at his doings he will cause that it shall soon overtake you.
If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?

And now behold, I tell you by the spirit of prophecy, that if ye transgress the commandments of God, behold, these things which are sacred shall be taken away from you by the power of God, and ye shall be delivered up unto Satan, that he may sift you as chaff before the wind.
See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven:
Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
And whosoever will harden his heart and will do iniquity, behold, I swear in my wrath that he shall not enter into my rest.

And now, behold, who can stand against the works of the Lord? Who can deny his sayings? Who will rise up against the almighty power of the Lord? Who will despise the works of the Lord? Who will despise the children of Christ? Behold, all ye who are despisers of the works of the Lord, for ye shall wonder and perish.
Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.
Then shalt thou say, O Lord, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will take away thy posterity, and will cut off from Ahab him that pisseth against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in Israel,

Moreover all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee, and overtake thee, till thou be destroyed; because thou hearkenedst not unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee:
Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?
And the king said, Whosoever saith ought unto thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.
For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.
And say unto it, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and I will make thee most desolate.
Where the word of a king is, there is power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou?

Behold, I am he of whom Moses spake, saying: A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you. And it shall come to pass that every soul who will not hear that prophet shall be cut off from among the people.

verses.text: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.

similars.text: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

verses.text: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?
Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.

similars.text: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

verses.text: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.
For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

similars.text: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

verses.text: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.

similars.text: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.text: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?

similars.text: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
And I will give unto him power to be mighty in testimony.
Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.
But if thou wilt go, do it, be strong for the battle: God shall make thee fall before the enemy: for God hath power to help, and to cast down.
The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.
The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.
The Lord therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
And the Lord is near, and he justifieth me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will smite him with the strength of my mouth.
Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.

And I know that the Lord God will consecrate my prayers for the gain of my people. And the words which I have written in weakness will be made strong unto them; for it persuadeth them to do good; it maketh known unto them of their fathers; and it speaketh of Jesus, and persuadeth them to believe in him, and to endure to the end, which is life eternal.
For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

verses.text: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.

similars.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

verses.text: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.
This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.

similars.text: And for this cause I said that he is a wicked man, for he has sought to take away the things wherewith you have been entrusted; and he has also sought to destroy your gift.

verses.text: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?

similars.text: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

verses.text: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

similars.text: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.

verses.text: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.
If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:
I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

similars.text: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?

verses.text: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?

similars.text: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.

verses.text: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;
Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.
For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.
Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.
Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:

similars.text: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

verses.text: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.

similars.text: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
